thread.title: SDSU's Christion Repeats As MVFC Newcomer Of The Week
thread.title_full: SDSU's Christion Repeats As MVFC Newcomer Of The Week

title: SDSU's Christion Repeats As MVFC Newcomer Of The Week
text:
SDSU's Christion Repeats As MVFC Newcomer Of The Week POSTED: 10:49 AM CDT Oct 19, 2015 Large Text BROOKINGS, S.D. - 
For the second week in a row, South Dakota State University quarterback Taryn Christion has been honored as the Missouri Valley Football Conference Newcomer of the Week. More from KDLT Center Of Hope Hosts Annual Fall Benefit This Saturday 
A freshman from Sioux Falls, Christion improved to 2-0 as South Dakota State’s starting quarterback, helping lead the Jackrabbits to their second consecutive win over a ranked opponent with a 38-8 win at Youngstown State on Oct. 17. Christion completed 8-of-14 passes for 122 yards and a touchdown, and also gained 75 yards on the ground. He scored on a 70-yard run early in the fourth quarter for the middle of three second-half touchdowns for the Jackrabbits. 
Christion's first weekly award came after accounting for 320 yards of total offense in his collegiate debut Oct. 10 against Indiana State. In that game, Christion threw for 221 yards and ran for 99 more. Copyright © 2015, KDLT. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed.
